de.fhb.sailboat.ufer.prototyp.utility

Class ConfigMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.fhb.sailboat.ufer.prototyp.utility.ConfigMap

  • public class ConfigMap
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a basic structure for configuration files. Entries are stored as identifier (for example "DebugMode") and value (for example "0") in string format. Once entered into the HashMap containing all added entries (configMap) the value will extended by (combined) the full config-Entry (for example "0" becomes "="";", meaning "DebugMode=0;"). If read, this procedure will be reversed, returning only the plain value associated to an identifier (for "DebugMode" -> "0").
    Author:
    Patrick Rutter

        public void put(java.lang.String identifier,
       java.lang.String value)

      • getEntryValue

        public java.lang.String getEntryValue(java.lang.String identifier)

      • getEntryIntegerValue

        public int getEntryIntegerValue(java.lang.String identifier)
        Returns the value of the specified identifier as integer. If such a identifier is not present -1 will be returned instead. This method requires the value to be in a valid format to work correctly ("1332" instead of "1332%").
        Parameters:
        identifier -
        Returns:
        representation of value as int

      • getEntryDoubleValue

        public double getEntryDoubleValue(java.lang.String identifier)
        Returns the value of the specified identifier as double. If such a identifier is not present -1 will be returned instead. This method requires the value to be in a valid format to work correctly ("0.1332" instead of "0.1332%").
        Parameters:
        identifier -
        Returns:
        representation of value as int

      • getEntryBooleanValue

        public boolean getEntryBooleanValue(java.lang.String identifier)
        Returns the value of the specified identifier as boolean. If such a identifier is not present false will be returned instead. Internally this method simply checks if value is equal to "1" oder "true", and will only then return true.
        Parameters:
        identifier -
        Returns:
